ranges.notes: Public holiday. Many businesses closed. Cold winter weather.
Public holiday. Winter continues.
Coldest month, potential for snow but less reliable than alpine regions. Fewer city tourists. Good time for museums, cozy cafes. Nearby skiing possible but depends on conditions.
Winter continues, cold but days start getting slightly longer. Carnival events (parades, balls) may occur leading up to Ash Wednesday. Good for indoor cultural activities.

ranges.event: Easter Markets & Holy Week (if Easter falls in March/early April)
ranges.notes: Transition to spring. Temperatures rising but can still be chilly. Potential for early Easter markets. Parks start showing green. Fewer tourists than peak season.

ranges.event: Easter Markets, Easter Monday (Public Holiday - date varies)
ranges.notes: Spring fully arrives. Parks and gardens (Eggenberg) are beautiful. Pleasant weather for city walks and exploring courtyards. Outdoor cafes begin opening.
Public holiday. Generally pleasant spring weather.

ranges.event: Springfestival (dates vary, often late May/early June), Ascension Day, Whit Monday (Public Holidays - dates vary)
ranges.notes: Excellent month. Warm weather, lush greenery. Ideal for exploring the city, parks, Mur river path. Start of festival season.

ranges.event: Styriarte Music Festival starts, Corpus Christi (Public Holiday - date varies)
ranges.notes: Start of summer. Warm, long days. Ideal for outdoor activities, visiting lakes (Schwarzlsee), enjoying beer gardens. Styriarte brings classical music.

ranges.event: Styriarte continues, La Strada Street Theatre Festival (usually late July/early Aug)
ranges.notes: Peak summer month. Warmest temperatures, can be hot and humid. Busy with tourists and festivals. Great for outdoor activities but expect crowds.

ranges.event: La Strada Street Theatre Festival may continue
ranges.notes: High summer season. Warm weather continues. Busy tourist period.
Public holiday. Peak summer tourism. Many locals may take vacation.
Late summer. Still warm, good for outdoor activities. Graz Food Festival often occurs this month.

ranges.event: Aufsteirern Festival, Steirischer Herbst begins (dates vary)
ranges.notes: Often beautiful, sunny 'Indian summer' days. Ideal for city exploration, hiking, visiting the wine region. Major cultural festivals start.

ranges.event: Steirischer Herbst continues, Lange Nacht der Museen, Graz Marathon, Klanglicht (dates vary)
ranges.notes: Autumn colors. Cooler but often pleasant weather. Good time for cultural events, museums, city walks. Wine region is beautiful.
Public holiday. Cultural events continue.
Late autumn. Days getting shorter and colder. Prepare for possibility of rain.
Public holiday. Quiet day, many businesses closed.
Often grey, cold, and potentially damp. Low tourist season. Good for indoor activities like museums and cafes.
Christmas markets begin opening towards the end of the month, bringing a festive atmosphere despite the weather.
Full festive swing. Christmas markets are the main attraction. Cozy atmosphere. Book accommodation early.
Public holiday, but markets and some shops may be open due to Christmas shopping season. Very busy.
Magical time to visit for the festive atmosphere. Very popular, expect crowds.
Public holidays. Most things closed, including markets (some close early on 24th). Very quiet family time.
Inter-holiday period. Some visitors, city relatively quiet compared to pre-Christmas.
Celebrations in the city, often events on Hauptplatz. Restaurants booked out.

spring: Exploring Eggenberg Palace gardens as they bloom
Walking or cycling the Murradweg (River Mur path)
Enjoying outdoor cafes in the Old Town
Hiking on lower trails around Graz (e.g., Platte, Plabutsch)
summer: Swimming at Schwarzlsee or other nearby lakes
Exploring the Old Town and Lend district
Hiking in the surrounding hills and mountains
Taking the Schlossberg lift/funicular for views
autumn: Visiting the South Styrian Wine Route (wine tasting, Buschenschanken)
Enjoying autumn colours in parks (Stadtpark, Eggenberg)
Visiting farmers markets for harvest produce (pumpkin!)
winter: Enjoying the festive lights and atmosphere in the Old Town
Enjoying traditional Styrian food in cozy restaurants
Taking day trips to nearby ski resorts (conditions permitting)

scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Ideal conditions, significant positive events, pleasant weather, potentially moderate crowds or peak festive season
scoreDescription.4: Good: Favorable conditions, good weather, possibly some key events, manageable or higher crowds (summer/Advent)
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard or transitional conditions, typical weather (can be cold/hot), fewer major events or public holidays with closures
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, potential for unfavorable weather (cold/damp), fewer activities
scoreDescription.1: Poor: Generally unfavorable conditions for typical tourism (rarely applicable)
